example.eg: Almost all coins are round.
example.egtrans: 几乎所有的硬币都是圆的。

example.eg: Tennis balls are round, but rugby balls are not.
example.egtrans: 网球是球形的，但橄揽球不是。

example.eg: He tied the belt round his waist.
example.egtrans: 他把皮带环腰系上。

example.eg: There's a supermarket just round this corner.
example.egtrans: 在这儿附近就有一家超市。

example.eg: The table has round corners.
example.egtrans: 那张桌子有圆弧形的角。

example.eg: He would eat ice cream all year round.
example.egtrans: 他一年到头都会吃冰淇淋。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 从头至尾地, 一年到头

example.eg: The foreign ministers entered their third round of negotiations.
example.egtrans: 各国外交部长开始了第三轮会谈。

example.eg: This is the third round in the playoffs.
example.egtrans: 这是季后赛的第三轮次了。

example.eg: I probably fired 100 rounds at the target.
example.egtrans: 我大概朝目标一次齐发了100枚弹药。

example.eg: She had beautiful round handwriting.
example.egtrans: 她写有一手漂亮圆润的字。

example.eg: 3.14 is not a round number, but 3 is.
example.egtrans: 3.14不是个整数，不过3是整数。

example.eg: Fat?  I prefer to say that she is round.
example.egtrans: 胖？我宁愿称她是体态丰满。

example.eg: Ground round is generally preferred over general ground beef.
example.egtrans: 与一般的绞牛肉相比，绞牛腿肉更受欢迎。

example.eg: Each round has a titanium tip.
example.egtrans: 每一枚子弹都有一个钛制弹头。

trans_examp.trans_cn: （子弹）一发, 一发子弹, 一枚子弹

example.eg: I said hi to the paperboy as he cycled past on his daily round.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 巡视, 巡查, 巡逻, 巡回

example.eg: Waiter! Another round of drinks!
example.egtrans: 服务员！再上一巡酒！

example.eg: The children sang 'London's Burning' in a round.
example.egtrans: 孩子们轮唱着“伦敦着火了”。

example.eg: I played two rounds of golf yesterday.
example.egtrans: 昨天，我打了两局高尔夫球。

example.eg: The boxer lasted just two rounds against the reigning champion.
example.egtrans: 对抗卫冕冠军的拳击手只坚持了两回合。

dsense.name: rounds
dsense.guideword: (routine check on hospital patients) (住院医生的)

example.eg: The doctor is making his rounds right now.
example.egtrans: 医生正在巡房。

example.eg: His face and body are beginning to round out now he is getting proper food.
example.egtrans: 他的脸和身体都开始变胖了，现在，他开始合理饮食了。

example.eg: She rounded the corners of the table to make it less dangerous.
The sports car rounded the corner quickly.
Round your answer to the nearest whole number.
They put a fence around the swimming pool.
example.egtrans: 他们在游泳池周围竖起了栅栏。

example.eg: They sat around the table wondering what to do next.
example.egtrans: 他们围坐在桌子旁，思考接下来要做什么。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 环绕, 在…周围, 围住

example.eg: Put the belt around your waist and then fasten it.
example.egtrans: 把安全带环绕在腰上，然后系紧。

example.eg: She travels around the country for her job.
example.egtrans: 她在全国各地到处出差。

example.eg: There were roads leading off all around the house.
example.egtrans: 有通向那栋房子各个方向的路。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 向四周, 向各个方向

example.eg: Books were spread all around the room.
example.egtrans: 书扔得满屋子都是。

example.eg: I'll see you around three o'clock.
example.egtrans: 我们三点左右见。

example.eg: The dog ran around and around trying to catch its tail.
example.egtrans: 这条狗转着圈跑来跑去，想抓住自己的尾巴。

example.eg: The guard entered the square and glanced around to see if any enemies were near.
example.egtrans: 守卫走上广场，四处查看，了解附近是否有敌人。

example.eg: The earth turns around on its axis.
example.egtrans: 地球绕地轴自转。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 环绕着, 围绕着（…转动等）

example.eg: It's around three inches tall and an inch wide.
example.egtrans: 它大约三英寸高，一英寸宽。

example.eg: It takes around 60 gallons of water to grow one avocado.
example.egtrans: 种植一株鳄梨需要大约60加仑的水。

example.eg: Plastic chairs have been around for thirty years.
Is she around? I want to ask her something.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 在附近的, 在左右的

example.eg: It's a beautiful house with trees all around.
example.egtrans: 这栋房子很漂亮，四周都是树。

example.eg: The vase is ten centimetres around.
example.egtrans: 这个花瓶周长为十厘米。

example.eg: There are lots of shops around.
example.egtrans: 这周围有很多商店。

example.eg: There are rumours going around.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 到处, 四处, 在各处

example.eg: The road goes around to the orchard.
example.egtrans: 这条路迂回地通往果园。

example.eg: The crowd watched with excitement as the cars raced around.
example.egtrans: 人群激动地看着车子绕着圈子飞驰。

example.eg: She came around to my house.  I drove round to the office to pick up some files.
example.egtrans: 她到我的家来了。我开车去办公司拿些文件。

example.eg: Is James around the office somewhere?
example.egtrans: 詹姆斯在办公室附近什么地方吗？

example.eg: We should go around town and put posters up.
example.egtrans: 我们应该去到城镇的各处张贴海报。

example.eg: The course is organized around important historical events.
example.egtrans: 该课程是围绕重要的历史事件所组织的。

example.eg: Victorians used smelling salts to bring round someone who had fainted.
example.egtrans: 维多利亚时代的人用嗅盐来唤醒晕厥的人。

example.eg: Wendy wasn't sure about moving to Florida, but her husband's talk of beaches brought her round.
example.egtrans: 温迪不确定是否要搬去佛罗里达州，但他丈夫关于海滩的一番话说服了她。

example.eg: Peter said that he would call round sometime this afternoon.

dsense.name: come around, also UK: come round

example.eg: The patient came around soon after his operation.
example.egtrans: 手术过后没多久，病人就苏醒了。

dsense.name: come around, also UK: come round

example.eg: My parents aren't keen on my new boyfriend, but they'll come round when they get to know him.
example.egtrans: 我的父母不喜欢我的新男友，但当他们了解了他之后，他们就会改变看法的。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 改变观点，改变看法, 被说服

dsense.name: come around, also UK: come round to [sth]

example.eg: Steve eventually came round to my opinion.
example.egtrans: 最终，史蒂夫改而接受我的观点了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 改变观点, 改而接受…的观点

dsense.name: come around, also UK: come round

example.eg: Jill always feels sad when the anniversary of her husband's death comes around.
example.egtrans: 每到丈夫的忌日，吉尔就会陷入悲痛之中。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 再次到来, 再次发生

dsense.name: drop around, also UK: drop round

example.eg: Steve dropped round earlier, while you were out; I said you'd phone him when you got back.
example.egtrans: 你早先出门的时候，史蒂夫来串门了；我告诉他你回来就会给他打电话。

dsense.name: drop around, also UK: drop [sth] round

example.eg: As you'll be passing my house anyway, could you drop that paperwork around?
example.egtrans: 反正你要经过我家，能不能顺便把那份文件带来？

example.eg: Gather round everybody!  Richard has something to say!

dsense.name: get around [sth], also UK: get round [sth]

example.eg: You can't get around the problem by pretending it doesn't exist.
example.egtrans: 你不能假装没有问题来回避。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 绕道而行, 绕开, 规避

dsense.name: get around, also UK: get round, get about

example.eg: When word got around that she was baking cookies, all the children appeared at her door.
example.egtrans: 她在烘焙饼干的消息传开后，所有孩子都出现在她门口。

dsense.name: get around to [sth], also UK: get round to [sth]

example.eg: Bill eventually got round to the washing-up.

dsense.name: get around to doing [sth], also UK: get round to doing [sth]

example.eg: One of these days, I will get around to making the trip to Paris.
You can't get round me with flattery - you're not getting a bike for Christmas, and that's final!
example.egtrans: 你别想通过阿谀奉承来说服我，圣诞节不会给你自行车的，别说了到此为止！

trans_examp.trans_cn: 说服某人, 哄骗某人改变想法

dsense.name: go around, also UK: go round

example.eg: The baby watched the top go round and laughed.  Each of the beautifully painted horses became visible as the carousel went around.
example.egtrans: 宝宝看着陀螺旋转，呵呵地笑。随着木马开始旋转，一匹匹精致绘制的木马都变得清晰可见。

dsense.name: go around, also UK: go round

example.eg: Do you think there'll be enough loaves and fishes to go around?
example.egtrans: 你认为有足够的面包和鱼给大家分么？

trans_examp.trans_cn: 够分, 分给所有人, 每个人都能分到

dsense.name: go around, also UK: go round, go about

example.eg: There's a nasty strain of flu going around.
example.egtrans: 有一种恶性流感正在肆虐。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 传染，传播, 流行，肆虐

dsense.name: go around, also UK: go round, go about

example.eg: He goes around looking filthy.  She goes about as if she owns the place.
example.egtrans: 他一直都邋里邋遢的。她举止大摇大摆，神气活现，好像这里是她家似得。

dsense.name: go around, also UK: go round, go about

example.eg: There's a rumour going round that you're cheating on Tim.
example.egtrans: 有谣言说你背着提姆在外面寻花问柳。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 传播，流传，四起, 散布

dsense.name: go around, also UK: go round

example.eg: I'll go round to your place when I'm done.
example.egtrans: 我完工后会去你那儿的。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 顺便拜访, 顺便走访

dsense.name: have [sb] over, also UK: have [sb] round, have [sb] around
look around for [sb/sth], also UK: look round for [sb/sth], look about for [sb/sth]

example.eg: I misplaced my keys, so I'll have to look around for them.
I need to borrow an electric drill, so I'm going to phone round my friends and see if anyone has one they can lend me.

dsense.name: rally around, also UK: rally round

example.eg: The neighbours rallied around to help Janet while her husband was sick.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 团结在一起, 把…团结在一起

dsense.name: rally around, also UK: rally round [sb]

example.eg: Everyone rallied round the mayor in his moment of crisis.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 团结在…的周围, 团结在…身边

example.eg: The answer was 5.1, so I rounded it down to 5.

dsense.name: round [sth] off, round [sth] off with [sth], round [sth] off by doing [sth]

example.eg: He rounded off his speech with a joke, leaving the audience in a good mood.
The price was eighty-seven euros, but the clerk rounded it off to eighty-five.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 以整数计, 四舍五入

example.eg: Lana trimmed her fingernails, then used an emery board to round off the ends.
The volunteer work Dave did last summer really rounded out his resume.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使饱满, 使丰满起来

example.eg: The sheep have scattered, so we must round them up again.
example.egtrans: 羊群散开了，所以我们必须再一次把它们聚拢。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使聚拢，驱拢, 赶到一起

example.eg: If we want to play football we must first round up some players.
example.egtrans: 如果想要踢足球，我们首先得召集一些球员。

example.eg: Round the answer up to the nearest 10.
example.egtrans: 将答案取整为10。

dsense.name: a millstone around your neck (US), a millstone round your neck (UK)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 如同套在脖子上的磨盘, 成为沉重负担

example.eg: Prices have increased all around.
example.egtrans: 各个地方物价都上涨了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 各个方面, 各个地方

example.eg: Joe called for drinks all around to celebrate his good news.
example.egtrans: 乔打电话给所有人来庆祝他的好消息。

example.eg: This is a better solution all round.
example.egtrans: 从各个方面看，这都是一个更好的解决方案。

example.eg: David looked all around him, but Eleanor was nowhere to be seen.
example.egtrans: 大卫环顾四周都未看到埃莉诺。

dsense.name: all year round, all the year round

example.eg: I'd love to live in a climate where I could garden all year round.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 全年，整年，一年四季, 一年到头

example.eg: Joe has developed into an all-around player for the basketball team.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 多才多艺的, 全能的

example.eg: The school aims to provide an all-around education for its students.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 全面的, 各个方面的

dsense.name: change [sth] around, change around [sth] (US), change [sth] round, change [sth] round (UK)

example.eg: You can change around the icons on your computer to make them more convenient.
The change around in the team's coaching has helped them win many more games this year.

dsense.name: come around, also UK: come round

example.eg: If you come round later, we can do our homework together.
example.egtrans: 如果你晚点来我家，我们可以一起做作业。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 短暂访问, 顺便拜访

example.eg: You're driving me round the bend!

dsense.name: get around doing [sth], also UK: get round doing [sth]

example.eg: The politician got around answering the question by changing the subject.
example.egtrans: 那个政客换了话题来回避回答这个问题。//这个商人钻法律的空子以规避税务。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 规避, 逃避, 避开

dsense.name: get round to [sth], get around to [sth]

example.eg: I didn't get round to any of the tasks on my to-do list today.
example.egtrans: 我今天无法抽出时间来做我待办事项清单上的任何事情。

dsense.name: get round to doing [sth], get around to doing [sth]

example.eg: This wall is so grubby; I must get round to repainting it.
example.egtrans: 这面墙真脏。我必须抽时间将它重新粉刷一下。

dsense.name: get your head around [sth], get your head round [sth]

example.eg: I'm trying to get my head around the subjunctive, but I'm still not sure when to use it.

dsense.name: go around [sth], also UK: go round [sth]

example.eg: I had grown so fat that none of my belts would go around my waist.
example.egtrans: 我长得太胖了，所有的皮带都小了，系不上腰。

dsense.name: go around [sth], also UK: go round [sth]

example.eg: The radio advised of heavy traffic downtown, so we went around the city instead.
example.egtrans: 广播提示说市中心交通拥堵，所以我们转而绕开了城镇。

example.eg: I'm going round the bend trying to get through all this work!  I can't solve the last crossword clue, and it's making me go round the bend.

dsense.name: in the round
dsense.guideword: (theatre: with audience surrounding stage) (剧院、剧场)

example.eg: After she mastered working with flat surfaces, the artist decided to try carving a statue in the round.
She asked the judge to consider the matter in the round.
He did not take the lead until the very last round of the contest.

dsense.name: last round
dsense.guideword: informal (most recent, final, serving drinks to a group) (非正式用语，酒的供应)

example.eg: You bought the last round, so now it's my turn.

dsense.name: look around, also UK: look round, look about

example.eg: I've been looking around everywhere, but I can't find my reading glasses.

dsense.name: look around [sth], also UK: look round [sth]

example.eg: Safety inspectors will be looking around the factory today.

dsense.name: look around, also UK: look round

example.eg: Sarah spent the afternoon looking around the local shops.
example.egtrans: 莎拉一下午都在四处浏览当地的商店。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 四处浏览, 四处看看

example.eg: They giggled as they rode the horses on the merry-go-round.
A lot of teenagers do paper rounds to earn some extra pocket money.

dsense.name: pass [sth] around, pass around [sth], also UK: pass [sth] round, pass round [sth]

example.eg: They passed around sandwiches and drinks at the party.

dsense.name: pass [sth] around [sth], also UK: pass [sth] round [sth]

example.eg: Please sign the petition and pass it round the office.

dsense.name: pass the hat, pass the hat round

example.eg: After the buskers had stopped playing, they passed the hat round.
The gerbil ran round and round in its wheel.
The puppy ran round and round the garden.
Ladies and gentlemen, please give him a round of applause!
The gymnast did a perfect round-off, landing without a wobble.
The round-off of 47 to the nearest ten is 50.
Every year I send out a round robin with my Christmas cards.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 群发邮件, 群发信息

example.eg: The teacher uses a round-robin approach to ensure all the students answer a question.
Tasks are assigned in a round robin.
He was an expert in his subject, and participated in round tables.
What on earth are you doing? Are you completely round the bend?
The suspected terrorist's house was under surveillance round the clock.
The round trip only takes four hours by car.
A round-trip ticket is usually cheaper than two one-way tickets.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 圆眼的, 长着圆眼睛的

example.eg: The children were riding on the roundabout.
example.egtrans: 孩子们骑着旋转木马玩。

example.eg: The cowboy was in the middle of a roundup when it started to rain.
The family watched the sports roundup on the evening news.
The police's roundup of suspects didn't result in an arrest.

dsense.name: run in circles, go around in circles, also UK: go round in circles
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (make no progress) (比喻未取得进展)

example.eg: This conversation just keeps going around in circles; we're not getting anywhere.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 原地打转, 没有进展

example.eg: Sally was asked to show her new classmate around.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 带...参观, 领...四处看看
